Makes a gentle grab to pull a small child out of harm's way from an oncoming skateboarder.
Leaves a sorrowful voicemail message asking Catch to call her, showing vulnerability and desire for connection.
Brushes away concern and refuses to talk about her feelings, appearing emotionally closed off.
Stops exercising abruptly from emotional pain and sorrow.
Leaves a voicemail asking Catch to call her, showing initiative to reach out despite emotional state.
Refuses to talk about her feelings and instead pushes through by focusing on the work at hand.
Immediately reacts to save a small child from danger quickly and gently.
Quickly grabs the child to pull him to safety from an oncoming skateboarder.
Recognizes an important lead (Elanora Chu), asks for address and phone, and promptly pursues it.
Approaches Elanora Chu with a mixture of confidence and emotional reservation, showing both professional initiative and some personal hesitation.
Seeks to understand and help Elanora's friend after the accident.
Shows emotional restraint and tries to maintain a tough cover over her feelings.
Takes him to the cemetery hoping to aid his healing process.
Underestimates the impact of her actions leading to him screaming at her.
Remembers an important event on her own and initiates a difficult conversation about the accident and its emotional aftermath.
Tries to help by taking him to the cemetery to confront the past, showing initiative and care.
Misjudges the timing or method of helping, as the person screams at her and refuses to enter the cemetery, indicating a possible lack of insight or tact.
Takes him to confront the truth despite emotional difficulty.
Admits to being scared and pushing hard out of fear.
Ignores signs he was already coming back, rushes him causing distance.
Takes the initiative to help someone confront their trauma by taking him to a difficult place—the cemetery—to seek the truth.
Is shaken and visibly affected by Elanora's explanations, showing emotional vulnerability and a lack of readiness to handle the emotional complexity of the situation.
Admits to pushing too hard out of fear and recognizes that her actions have driven the person away, displaying self-awareness but also ineffective approach.
Reaches out to touch Elanora's hand to say goodbye, showing a need for connection despite her misery.
Prepares to attend her parents' renewal of vows and attempts to wish them well despite personal pain, indicating sincerity and effort to maintain relationships.
Admits she didn't know what she was doing and worries she might have made things worse.
Despite being emotionally distraught, makes an effort to attend her parents' renewal of vows and prepares a gift.
Uncertain in appearance and hesitant with the gift decoration, indicating low confidence and indecisiveness.
Re-wraps the gift multiple times, showing care and attention to detail.
Arrives quietly, looking nervous and sad, attends ceremony despite tension, exchanges a brief friendly nod with Kathy, winks at Larry Jr.
Does not engage openly with Larry, who is tense and angry toward her, maintaining her composure and attending the event calmly.
Re-wraps gift multiple times to improve its appearance before the ceremony.
Arrives at the church on time, parks, takes a deep breath, and quietly enters the ceremony already in progress, showing careful planning.
Moves forward and slips into a pew despite slight disturbance, managing social discomfort gracefully.
Acknowledges and interacts subtly with family members (winks at Larry Jr., nods at Kathy) indicating social awareness and confidence.
Takes initiative to approach the group and speak up despite feeling nervous and unsure of what to do.
Compliments her parents despite the strained atmosphere, saying 'You both look so great.'
Engages politely with Mrs. Vander and her husband, compliments Mrs. Vander's dress.
Tries to catch up with Larry and calls out to him after he initially ignores her.
Acknowledges the strained relationship with Larry but expresses a sincere intention to make things right.
Follows the Photographer's gesture and positions herself beside her Mother for the family photo.
Attempts to engage with her parents despite emotional strain, saying 'You both look so great.'
Engages politely with Mrs. Vander and her husband, showing social awareness.
Tries to catch up with Larry and initiates conversation despite his hostility.
States she is taking the chance to make things right after breaking her word.
Larry ignores her attempts to communicate, showing potential failure in conflict resolution.
Comforts Kathy and takes responsibility by saying 'I took it on' when Larry was abusive to Kathy, showing protective and emotionally intelligent behavior.
Engages thoughtfully with her mother, notices emotional cues, and responds supportively, indicating emotional awareness and strong interpersonal skills.
Attempts to distract Larry Jr. from his sadness by creatively pretending the party is like a TV show, showing quick thinking and empathy.
Plays along with a child's imaginative story to entertain him.
Keeps her voice low and shows anger and embarrassment when confronted by her brother, then battles her hurt and anger to re-enter the room.
Is met with lack of support from her mother during a tense moment.
Accurately observes and suspects that a man drugged a woman’s drink, showing situational awareness.
Remains angry, embarrassed, and loses voice control when confronted by her brother, indicating emotional overwhelm.
Despite feeling shaken and unsupported, she fights old patterns and chooses to re-enter the situation rather than leaving, demonstrating inner strength and deliberate choice.
Follows her father into the kitchen despite others leaving, trying to engage him and check on his hearing aid.
Confronts Larry and mother with anger and demands, but asserts boundaries for her father’s sake.
Moves decisively through the crowd to confront her father despite tension around her.
Calmly tries to address her father's hearing aid problem to facilitate communication.
Stands up firmly to Larry's aggression with controlled fury, effectively halting his advance.
Clearly sets boundaries by telling Larry and her mother to leave the interaction alone.
Repeatedly asks her father if he wants her to leave, demonstrating patience and respect despite tension.
Asks her father if she is welcome and if he loves her, exposing her vulnerability despite the painful silence and rejection.
Responds calmly and with quiet strength to her father's painful statement that he feels like he doesn't have a daughter anymore, showing resilience and a measure of forgiveness.
Leaves after the rejection, moving past her family without confrontation, indicating restraint and perhaps avoidance of escalating conflict.
Voluntarily steps in front of a video camera to speak to her parents, openly sharing emotions and memories despite apparent family tensions, signaling sincerity and an attempt at connection.
Faces painful rejection from her father but remains composed and does not crumble, showing emotional resilience and control.
Confronts the video crew decisively and confidently announces herself to the camera, taking control of the situation.
Speaks thoughtfully and purposefully to her family via the camera, managing complex emotions while maintaining clarity.
Shares a vulnerable, affectionate memory of playing with her dad and expresses gratitude, showing openness and sincerity.
Returns a smile to Larry Jr., indicating friendly and positive social engagement.
Calmly narrates a tense childhood memory with clarity and emotional insight, showing self-awareness and reflective capability.
Expresses gratitude thoughtfully and succinctly, indicating emotional intelligence and social skill.
Walks away without confrontation despite a charged moment, demonstrating composed behavior rather than impulsiveness.
Responds to Larry Jr.'s smile warmly, showing social perceptiveness and emotional connection.
Shows emotional vulnerability and honesty about her past and feelings, expressing regret and mourning but admitting she did what she believed was right.
Admits to not knowing what else to do at age 19 but acted decisively to stop a bad situation.
Feels and expresses deep pain about being shut out and not having a family anymore, showing emotional struggle but no sign of giving up.
Covers Catch's hands gently and closes her eyes, smiles through her tears, and reciprocates his embrace.
Sits quietly and drained after crying but makes no fuss when Catch offers to drive and she accepts.
